net.hudup.alg.cf.gfall

Class FreqItemsetBasedCF

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AbstractAlg
      • net.hudup.core.alg.Recommender
        • net.hudup.core.alg.ModelBasedRecommender
          • net.hudup.core.alg.cf.ModelBasedCF
            • net.hudup.alg.cf.gfall.FreqItemsetBasedCF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Alg, ModelBasedAlg
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AprioriCF, GreenFallCF

    public abstract class FreqItemsetBasedCF
extends ModelBasedCF
    This abstract class is the abstract model of any collaborative filtering (CF) algorithm based on mining frequent itemsets. It is a model-based recommendation algorithm (model-based recommender).
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createKB

        public KBase createKB()
        Description copied from interface: ModelBasedAlg
        Creating a new knowledge base represented by KBase interface. Normally, KBase is created from dataset. For example, if model-based recommender uses frequent purchase pattern to make recommendation, the new KBase contains such pattern.
        Returns:
        knowledge base KBase

      • estimate

        public RatingVector estimate(RecommendParam param,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryIds)
        Description copied from class: Recommender
        This method is very important, which is used to estimate rating values of given items (users). Any class that extends this abstract class must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and a set of item (user) identifiers. The output result is a set of predictive or estimated rating values of items (users) specified by the second input parameter.
        Specified by:
        estimate in class Recommender
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        queryIds - set of identifications (IDs) of items that need to be estimated their rating values.
        Returns:
        rating vector contains estimated rating values of the specified set of IDs of items (users).

      • estimate

        protected FreqItemsetBasedCF.Estimate estimate(RecommendParam param,
                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> queryIds,
                                               double referredRatingValue,
                                               RatingFilter ratingFilter)
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter specified by RecommendParam
        queryIds - query identifiers (IDs). Such IDs can be item IDs or user IDs.
        referredRatingValue - referred rating value.
        ratingFilter - specified rating filter specified by RatingFilter.
        Returns:
        FreqItemsetBasedCF.Estimate

      • recommend

        public RatingVector recommend(RecommendParam param,
                              int maxRecommend)
        Description copied from class: Recommender
        This method is the most important one in recommendation task. Any class that extends this abstract class must implement this method. Note that the role of user and the role of item are exchangeable. Rating vector can be user rating vector or item rating vector. Please see RatingVector for more details. The input parameters are a recommendation parameter and the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector. The output result is a list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item).
        Specified by:
        recommend in class Recommender
        Parameters:
        param - recommendation parameter. Please see RecommendParam for more details of this parameter.
        maxRecommend - the maximum recommended items (users) in the returned rating vector.
        Returns:
        list of recommended items (users) which is provided to the user (item), represented by RatingVector class. The number of items (users) of such list is specified by the the maximum number.

      • optimizeRecommend

        protected RatingVector optimizeRecommend(BitItemset itemset,
                                         RatingVector rec,
                                         int maxRecommend)
        Parameters:
        itemset - specified bit itemset specified by BitItemset class.
        rec - recommended rating vector.
        maxRecommend - maximum number of items in recommended list.
        Returns:
        optimized RatingVector
